channel.title: New Laptop
channel.description:
If you've been on irc over the past few weeks you will have noticed that I've been bitching and complaining for a new laptop because mine is officially fried. For a while I had my eye on the "Acer Aspire One" with a 8.9 inch lcd screen, 120GB hard drive, 1gb RAM, Intel Atom processor N270 (1.60 GHz, 533 MHz FSB, 512 KB L2 cache), etc (http://www.ncix.com/products/index.php?sku=31428&vpn=LU%2ES050B%2E002&manufacture=Acer)
I wanted it because it was a nice, quick laptop which would be really good for school because of it's maneuverability and a long battery life (6-cell). Today I was linked to an even better laptop which I now have my eyes on: http://www.bestbuy.ca/catalog/proddetail.asp?sku_id=0926INGFS10103961&catid=25253&PCName=laptop_under_799&logon=&langid=EN#
This laptop is not only good for school, it's good for just about everything else too, it lacks in the gaming department, but that's why I have an xbox. With 2gb Vista should run a little faster, so I'm not too worried about that. If worse comes to worse I'll dual-boot it with xp and call it a day. Right now I have enough money to buy either of the laptops. I'm pretty sure I'm going to go with the Acer Aspire, however the Acer Aspire One beats it in looks.
I'm just curious, what is your opinion?

item.title: New Laptop
item.dc:creator: @reVein reVein
item.description:
@reVein wrote:

I bought a new laptop last week for 649€, about $930. 15,4 screen, 320gb hdd, 4gb ram etc. etc., one thing that sucks is that all new laptops have 32-bit vista installed, so it automatically takes 1gb of your ram. You better not get a laptop with 1gb ram.

Oh and I saw that bottom Acer laptop in the store too, about the same price but it didn’t look very cool, don’t know why.

Read full topic
